page.title: 05Fishing in Alderney
page.content: The waters around Alderney are full of many species of fish.Most of the commercial fishing though is involved in shellfish.The average catch per pot per week is 70.The boats go out two times a day.The boats do not go potting on spring tides.Fish is sold in France,to hotels, restaurants and to the general public.There is one trawler, a beam trawler. The sort of shell fish caught are crab and lobster. Fishing is also done by long line,hand line and netting.There are 28 potters (not all full-time)in the harbour but there are only 10 working trotters and netters. Some boats have their own fish wells on board,others have store pots anchored to mooring buoys in the harbour.
